The photo was published on October 14: 2019, in a Facebook post that claimed it showed a temporary road built in 24 hours after Typhoon Hagibis hit Japan.
The post: s Indonesian-language caption translated to English as: "An emergency bridge was built within 24 hours as the highway was blocked by a landslide. This incident happened after a typhoon hit Japan. Constructing a bridge only in 24 hours, amazing."
The image was shared on Facebook and Twi: 4. A reverse image search on Yandex found the same image posted on Twitter on March 22, 2019, with a caption stating it was a national highway in Fukui city, Japan, after a landslide damaged it in July 2018.
